intro: Schmidelia distachya, commonly known as the two-stemmed schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Schmidelia distachya is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to sunny environments.
